title: ESPN star annoyed with airport protesters: You disrupted me
text:
LOS ANGELES — An ESPN anchor who vented about missing her flight because of airport immigration protesters is drawing criticism from people who say she is being insensitive.

Sage Steele posted a photo of protesters speaking out against President Donald Trump’s order to temporarily suspend immigration from seven Muslim-majority nations at Los Angeles International Airport on Instagram on Sunday night.

In the caption, she noted that she and other passengers had to drag luggage nearly two miles to get to the airport, and still missed their flights. She writes that she loves seeing people exercise their right to protest, but was saddened “to see the joy on their faces knowing that they were successful in disrupting so many people’s travel plans.”

Steele, featured in “SportsCenter On The Road” and ABC’s “NBA Countdown,” defended her post to various critics on Twitter, excusing it as “just my opinion” and saying there are “more effective ways” of protest.

Steele had been criticized — and praised — in November for shaming Tampa Bay’s Mike Evans for not standing during the national anthem.

An ESPN spokesman declined comment.
